title: Day one at Axe-con 2026
partialText:
Day one of Axe-con 2026 is in the books! From tactical and technical to educational and inspirational, Axe-con covers it all—from AI and the EAA to Proactive Inclusion and Shifting Left!

The post Day one at Axe-con 2026 appeared first on Deque.

title: Axe Awards at Axe-con 2026
partialText:
The Axe Awards represent a very special opportunity to honor and celebrate the people and organizations doing notably impactful work in accessibility. We have four awards to present: the Accessibility Culture Award, the Accessibility at Scale Award, the Longstanding Commitment to Accessibility Award, and the Jim Thatcher Lifetime Achievement Award.

The post Axe Awards at Axe-con 2026 appeared first on Deque.

title: The Accessible Canada Act: Deadlines are closer than you think
partialText:

title: The rise of AI-powered pro se lawsuits and the case for proactive accessibility
partialText:
Federal pro se ADA Title III lawsuits were up 40% YoY in 2025, and recent research shows a majority of litigants using AI tools. What does this mean for businesses, and what does it say about AI and digital accessibility?

The post The rise of AI-powered pro se lawsuits and the case for proactive accessibility appeared first on Deque.
